content:
On the GitHub releases, what's the difference between

  • roc-linux_arm64-0-alpha2-rolling.tar.gz

  • roc-linux_x86_64-0-alpha2-rolling.tar.gz
    and

  • roc-old_linux_arm64-0-alpha2-rolling.tar.gz

  • roc-old_linux_x86_64-0-alpha2-rolling.tar.gz

The old ones are built with debian buster, so if you're using an old OS yourself, these may be the only ones that work. I do think I'm going to try not providing old releases with alpha3 and see if anyone complains about it. I don't know of anyone that is using them now.
Hannes has marked this topic as resolved.
